com.example.octofy

Class CarouselAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.widget.BaseAdapter
      • com.example.octofy.CarouselAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.widget.Adapter, android.widget.ListAdapter, android.widget.SpinnerAdapter

    public class CarouselAdapter
extends android.widget.BaseAdapter
    Adapter to display images in a Carousel. Displays numOfImagesToShow images at one time.
    See Also:
    Carousel, CarouselList

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface android.widget.Adapter

        IGNORE_ITEM_VIEW_TYPE, NO_SELECTION

    • Constructor Summary

      Public class constructor.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void browseLeft()
      Called when left button is clicked, to browse to the left in the carousel list.

      Called when right button is clicked, to browse to the right in the carousel list.

      Get the length of the subarray to show at once.

                       int[] counts,
                       java.lang.String[] imgPaths)
        Sets tag data for the carousel.
        Parameters:
        tags - array with tag names
        counts - array with tag counts
        imgPaths - paths to corresponding tag images, assumed to be in res/drawable

      • getView

        public android.view.View getView(int position,
                                 android.view.View convertView,
                                 android.view.ViewGroup parent)
        Get view of one image in the CarouselList. On click the count for the image is incremented by one. A toast shows the current count.
        Parameters:
        position - The position of the object of which the view should be returned
        convertView - ConvertView
        parent - Parent
        Returns:
        View of the object to show

      • getFirstIndex

        public int getFirstIndex()
        Get the index of the tag object at the leftmost in the carousel list.
        Returns:
        first index

      • browseRight

        public void browseRight()
        Called when right button is clicked, to browse to the right in the carousel list. The first index is therefore increased by 1.

      • browseLeft

        public void browseLeft()
        Called when left button is clicked, to browse to the left in the carousel list. The first index is therefore decreased by 1.
